CVE-2024-35260
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-27T18:31:38

4 posts

Microsoft Dataverse Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-06-27T20:50:38.000Z ##

Microsoft says it will issue CVEs for security issues in its cloud services

https://msrc.microsoft.com/blog/2024/06/toward-greater-transparency-unveiling-cloud-service-cves/

Example CVE: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-35260

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-27T17:58:19.235Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisory: Microsoft Dataverse Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
CVE-2024-35260 (CVSS:3.1 8.0 high, disclosed 27 June 2024 by Microsoft) was unexpectedly announced today (out-of-band outside of Patch Tuesday). Remarks:

  • The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve
  • Weakness: CWE-426: Untrusted Search Path
  • Why are there no links to an update or instructions with steps that must be taken to protect from this vulnerability?
    This vulnerability has already been fully mitigated by Microsoft. There is no action for users of this service to take. This purpose of this CVE is to provide further transparency. Please see Toward greater transparency: Unveiling Cloud Service CVEs for more information.

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation more likely.

#CVE_2024_35260 #MSRC #vulnerability #CVE #Microsoft #Dataverse

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T17:58:19.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisory: Microsoft Dataverse Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
CVE-2024-35260 (CVSS:3.1 8.0 high, disclosed 27 June 2024 by Microsoft) was unexpectedly announced today (out-of-band outside of Patch Tuesday). Remarks:

  • The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve
  • Weakness: CWE-426: Untrusted Search Path
  • Why are there no links to an update or instructions with steps that must be taken to protect from this vulnerability?
    This vulnerability has already been fully mitigated by Microsoft. There is no action for users of this service to take. This purpose of this CVE is to provide further transparency. Please see Toward greater transparency: Unveiling Cloud Service CVEs for more information.

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation more likely.

#CVE_2024_35260 #MSRC #vulnerability #CVE #Microsoft #Dataverse

##

CVE-2024-28820(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-27T18:31:37

2 posts

Buffer overflow in the extract_openvpn_cr function in openvpn-cr.c in openvpn-auth-ldap (aka the Three Rings Auth-LDAP plugin for OpenVPN) 2.0.4 allows attackers with a valid LDAP username and who can control the challenge/response password field to pass a string with more than 14 colons into this field and cause a buffer overflow.

cadey@pony.social at 2024-06-27T23:39:06.000Z ##

"No way to prevent this" say users of only language where this regularly happens

https://xeiaso.net/shitposts/no-way-to-prevent-this/CVE-2024-28820/

##
cadey@pony.social at 2024-06-27T23:39:06.000Z ##

"No way to prevent this" say users of only language where this regularly happens

https://xeiaso.net/shitposts/no-way-to-prevent-this/CVE-2024-28820/

##

CVE-2024-5535(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-27T18:31:32

4 posts

Issue summary: Calling the OpenSSL API function SSL_select_next_proto with an empty supported client protocols buffer may cause a crash or memory contents to be sent to the peer. Impact summary: A buffer overread can have a range of potential consequences such as unexpected application beahviour or a crash. In particular this issue could result in up to 255 bytes of arbitrary private data from me

wezm@mastodon.decentralised.social at 2024-06-27T23:39:58.000Z ##

CVE-2024-5535: OpenSSL`SSL_select_next_proto` buffer overread:
Silently sends up to 255 bytes of the client’s heap to the server.

> **2024-04-23** - Discovery of `SSL_select_next_proto` memory unsafety while rewriting it in rust.

https://jbp.io/2024/06/27/cve-2024-5535-openssl-memory-safety.html #rust #RustLang

##
cadey@pony.social at 2024-06-27T18:13:53.000Z ##

"No way to prevent this" say users of only language where this regularly happens

https://xeiaso.net/shitposts/no-way-to-prevent-this/CVE-2024-5535/

##

##

CVE-2024-3115
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-27T12:47:19.847000

2 posts

An issue was discovered in GitLab EE affecting all versions starting from 16.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to access issues and epics without having an SSO session using Duo Chat.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-26T19:29:26.695Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Critical Patch Release: 17.1.1, 17.0.3, 16.11.5
14 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-5655 (9.6 Critical) Run pipelines as any user
  • CVE-2024-4901 (8.7 high) Stored XSS injected in imported project's commit notes
  • CVE-2024-4994 (8.1 high) CSRF on GraphQL API IntrospectionQuery
  • CVE-2024-6323 (7.5 high) Remove search results from public projects with unauthorized repos
  • CVE-2024-2177 (6.8 medium) Cross window forgery in user application OAuth flow
  • CVE-2024-5430 (6.8 medium) Project maintainers can bypass group's merge request approval policy
  • CVE-2024-4025 (6.5 medium) ReDoS via custom built markdown page
  • CVE-2024-3959 (6.5 medium) Private job artifacts can be accessed by any user
  • CVE-2024-4557 (6.5 medium) Security fixes for banzai pipeline
  • CVE-2024-1493 (6.5 medium) ReDoS in dependency linker
  • CVE-2024-1816 (5.3 medium) Denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file
  • CVE-2024-2191 (5.3 medium) Merge request title disclosure
  • CVE-2024-3115 (4.3 medium) Access issues and epics without having an SSO session
  • CVE-2024-4011 (3.1 low) Non project member can promote key results to objectives

#GitLab #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-1086
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.21%

updated 2024-06-27T12:30:43

2 posts

A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's netfilter: nf_tables component can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. The nft_verdict_init() function allows positive values as drop error within the hook verdict, and hence the nf_hook_slow() function can cause a double free vulnerability when NF_DROP is issued with a drop error which resembles NF_ACCEPT. We recommend upgradi

5 repos

https://github.com/Notselwyn/CVE-2024-1086

https://github.com/feely666/CVE-2024-1086

https://github.com/Alicey0719/docker-POC_CVE-2024-1086

https://github.com/CCIEVoice2009/CVE-2024-1086

https://github.com/kevcooper/CVE-2024-1086-checker

stdevel@chaos.social at 2024-06-28T06:42:54.000Z ##

Im Juni wurden u.a. #NixOS 24.05 und SLES sowie #openSUSE Leap 15 SP6 veröffentlicht. Zabbix erschien in der neuen Version 7.0. Neben zahlreichen Software-Updates wurden auch neue ARM- und RISC-V-Notebooks angekündigt. Der Sovereign Tech Fund startet in eine nächste Förderrunde, während Debian intern über verschiedene Themen diskutiert.

🎧 https://focusonlinux.podigee.io/109-newsupdate-0624-cve-2024-1086-nixos-2405-slesopensuse-leap-156-zabbix-70-risc-v-und-arm-hadware

Neben zahlreichen Software-Updates wurden auch neue ARM- und RISC-V-Notebooks angekündigt. 🎧 https://focusonlinux.podigee.io/109-newsupdate-0624-cve-2024-1086-nixos-2405-slesopensuse-leap-156-zabbix-70-risc-v-und-arm-hadware

#FocusOnLinux #Linux #Podcast #ZwoEinsRISCio

##

CVE-2024-6290(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-27T03:30:56

4 posts

Use after free in Dawn in Google Chrome prior to 126.0.6478.126 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-06-27T20:15:17.726Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) has five total Chromium-based security advisories. See parent toot above for the Google Chrome blog post disclosing four of the CVE IDs on 25 June 2024. CVE-2024-6290 through CVE-2024-6293 are included by MSRC (note: MSRC got lazy and didn't include the whole description in the title e.g. "Chromium: CVE-2024-6290 Use after free in Dawn").
The new CVE ID is CVE-2024-34122 (7.3 high severity) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. Interestingly "The vulnerability assigned to this CVE is in Adobe Software which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based)." The Common Weakness and Enumeration is CWE-125: Out-of-bounds Read. It is marked Not exploited, Not publicly disclosed and Exploitation Less Likely.

#CVE_2024_34122 #MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE #Adobe

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-24T21:34:15.693Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
5 security fixes, 4 externally reported (no mention of exploitation):

  • CVE-2024-6290 (high severity) Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-6291 (high severity) Use after free in Swiftshader
  • CVE-2024-6292 (high severity) Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-6293 (high severity) Use after free in Dawn

#Google #Chrome #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-6323
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-27T00:31:11

4 posts

Improper authorization in global search in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 16.11 prior to 16.11.5 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.3 and 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 allows an attacker leak content of a private repository in a public project.

H3liumb0y at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.552Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

CVE-2024-6323 - High
Improper authorization in global search in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 16.11 prior to 16.11.5 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.3 and 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 allows an attacker leak content of a private repository in a public project.

CVE-2024-4901 - High
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, where a stored XSS vulnerability could be imported from a project with malicious commit notes.

CVE-2024-1816 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 12.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows for an attacker to cause a denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file.

CVE-2024-2191 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

CVE-2024-3959 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium
Multiple Denial of Service DoS conditions has been discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

CVE-2024-5430 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

CVE-2024-4011 - Low
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

Tags

#GitLab #CVE-2024-5655 #CWE-284 #CWE-79 #CWE-352 #SecurityPatch #Vulnerability #DevOps #CI/CD

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-26T19:29:26.695Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Critical Patch Release: 17.1.1, 17.0.3, 16.11.5
14 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-5655 (9.6 Critical) Run pipelines as any user
  • CVE-2024-4901 (8.7 high) Stored XSS injected in imported project's commit notes
  • CVE-2024-4994 (8.1 high) CSRF on GraphQL API IntrospectionQuery
  • CVE-2024-6323 (7.5 high) Remove search results from public projects with unauthorized repos
  • CVE-2024-2177 (6.8 medium) Cross window forgery in user application OAuth flow
  • CVE-2024-5430 (6.8 medium) Project maintainers can bypass group's merge request approval policy
  • CVE-2024-4025 (6.5 medium) ReDoS via custom built markdown page
  • CVE-2024-3959 (6.5 medium) Private job artifacts can be accessed by any user
  • CVE-2024-4557 (6.5 medium) Security fixes for banzai pipeline
  • CVE-2024-1493 (6.5 medium) ReDoS in dependency linker
  • CVE-2024-1816 (5.3 medium) Denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file
  • CVE-2024-2191 (5.3 medium) Merge request title disclosure
  • CVE-2024-3115 (4.3 medium) Access issues and epics without having an SSO session
  • CVE-2024-4011 (3.1 low) Non project member can promote key results to objectives

#GitLab #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.000Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

CVE-2024-6323 - High
Improper authorization in global search in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 16.11 prior to 16.11.5 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.3 and 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 allows an attacker leak content of a private repository in a public project.

CVE-2024-4901 - High
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, where a stored XSS vulnerability could be imported from a project with malicious commit notes.

CVE-2024-1816 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 12.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows for an attacker to cause a denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file.

CVE-2024-2191 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

CVE-2024-3959 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium
Multiple Denial of Service DoS conditions has been discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

CVE-2024-5430 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

CVE-2024-4011 - Low
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

Tags

#GitLab #CVE-2024-5655 #CWE-284 #CWE-79 #CWE-352 #SecurityPatch #Vulnerability #DevOps #CI/CD

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T19:29:26.000Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Critical Patch Release: 17.1.1, 17.0.3, 16.11.5
14 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-5655 (9.6 Critical) Run pipelines as any user
  • CVE-2024-4901 (8.7 high) Stored XSS injected in imported project's commit notes
  • CVE-2024-4994 (8.1 high) CSRF on GraphQL API IntrospectionQuery
  • CVE-2024-6323 (7.5 high) Remove search results from public projects with unauthorized repos
  • CVE-2024-2177 (6.8 medium) Cross window forgery in user application OAuth flow
  • CVE-2024-5430 (6.8 medium) Project maintainers can bypass group's merge request approval policy
  • CVE-2024-4025 (6.5 medium) ReDoS via custom built markdown page
  • CVE-2024-3959 (6.5 medium) Private job artifacts can be accessed by any user
  • CVE-2024-4557 (6.5 medium) Security fixes for banzai pipeline
  • CVE-2024-1493 (6.5 medium) ReDoS in dependency linker
  • CVE-2024-1816 (5.3 medium) Denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file
  • CVE-2024-2191 (5.3 medium) Merge request title disclosure
  • CVE-2024-3115 (4.3 medium) Access issues and epics without having an SSO session
  • CVE-2024-4011 (3.1 low) Non project member can promote key results to objectives

#GitLab #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-2191
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-27T00:31:11

4 posts

An issue was discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

H3liumb0y at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.552Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

CVE-2024-6323 - High
Improper authorization in global search in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 16.11 prior to 16.11.5 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.3 and 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 allows an attacker leak content of a private repository in a public project.

CVE-2024-4901 - High
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, where a stored XSS vulnerability could be imported from a project with malicious commit notes.

CVE-2024-1816 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 12.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows for an attacker to cause a denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file.

CVE-2024-2191 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

CVE-2024-3959 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium
Multiple Denial of Service DoS conditions has been discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

CVE-2024-5430 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

CVE-2024-4011 - Low
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.000Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

CVE-2024-6323 - High
Improper authorization in global search in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 16.11 prior to 16.11.5 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.3 and 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 allows an attacker leak content of a private repository in a public project.

CVE-2024-4901 - High
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, where a stored XSS vulnerability could be imported from a project with malicious commit notes.

CVE-2024-1816 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 12.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows for an attacker to cause a denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file.

CVE-2024-2191 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

CVE-2024-3959 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium
Multiple Denial of Service DoS conditions has been discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

CVE-2024-5430 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

CVE-2024-4011 - Low
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

patchnow24x7 at 2024-06-28T04:32:59.011Z ##

CVE-2024-5655 :: CVSS Score : 9.6 :: Upgrade your GitLab (Both Enterprise Edition and Community Edition) to the latest version.

Advisory:

https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/cves/-/blob/master/2024/CVE-2024-5655.json

#gitlab

#PatchNOW

#cybersecurity

#hacked

#Cyberattack

#infosec

#informationsecurity

#CyberSecurityAwareness

#DataBreach

#zeroday

#tech

#privacy

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.000Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

CVE-2024-6323 - High
Improper authorization in global search in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 16.11 prior to 16.11.5 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.3 and 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 allows an attacker leak content of a private repository in a public project.

CVE-2024-4901 - High
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, where a stored XSS vulnerability could be imported from a project with malicious commit notes.

CVE-2024-1816 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 12.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows for an attacker to cause a denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file.

CVE-2024-2191 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

CVE-2024-3959 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium
Multiple Denial of Service DoS conditions has been discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

CVE-2024-5430 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

CVE-2024-4011 - Low
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

Tags

#GitLab #CVE-2024-5655 #CWE-284 #CWE-79 #CWE-352 #SecurityPatch #Vulnerability #DevOps #CI/CD

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T19:29:26.000Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Critical Patch Release: 17.1.1, 17.0.3, 16.11.5
14 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-5655 (9.6 Critical) Run pipelines as any user
  • CVE-2024-4901 (8.7 high) Stored XSS injected in imported project's commit notes
  • CVE-2024-4994 (8.1 high) CSRF on GraphQL API IntrospectionQuery
  • CVE-2024-6323 (7.5 high) Remove search results from public projects with unauthorized repos
  • CVE-2024-2177 (6.8 medium) Cross window forgery in user application OAuth flow
  • CVE-2024-5430 (6.8 medium) Project maintainers can bypass group's merge request approval policy
  • CVE-2024-4025 (6.5 medium) ReDoS via custom built markdown page
  • CVE-2024-3959 (6.5 medium) Private job artifacts can be accessed by any user
  • CVE-2024-4557 (6.5 medium) Security fixes for banzai pipeline
  • CVE-2024-1493 (6.5 medium) ReDoS in dependency linker
  • CVE-2024-1816 (5.3 medium) Denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file
  • CVE-2024-2191 (5.3 medium) Merge request title disclosure
  • CVE-2024-3115 (4.3 medium) Access issues and epics without having an SSO session
  • CVE-2024-4011 (3.1 low) Non project member can promote key results to objectives

#GitLab #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-1816
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-27T00:31:10

4 posts

An issue was discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions starting from 12.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows for an attacker to cause a denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file.

H3liumb0y at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.552Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

CVE-2024-6323 - High
Improper authorization in global search in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 16.11 prior to 16.11.5 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.3 and 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 allows an attacker leak content of a private repository in a public project.

CVE-2024-4901 - High
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, where a stored XSS vulnerability could be imported from a project with malicious commit notes.

CVE-2024-1816 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 12.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows for an attacker to cause a denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file.

CVE-2024-2191 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

CVE-2024-3959 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium
Multiple Denial of Service DoS conditions has been discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

CVE-2024-5430 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

CVE-2024-4011 - Low
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

Tags

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.000Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

CVE-2024-6323 - High
Improper authorization in global search in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 16.11 prior to 16.11.5 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.3 and 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 allows an attacker leak content of a private repository in a public project.

CVE-2024-4901 - High
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, where a stored XSS vulnerability could be imported from a project with malicious commit notes.

CVE-2024-1816 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 12.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows for an attacker to cause a denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file.

CVE-2024-2191 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

CVE-2024-3959 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium
Multiple Denial of Service DoS conditions has been discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

CVE-2024-5430 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

CVE-2024-4011 - Low
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

Tags

#GitLab #CVE-2024-5655 #CWE-284 #CWE-79 #CWE-352 #SecurityPatch #Vulnerability #DevOps #CI/CD

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T19:29:26.000Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Critical Patch Release: 17.1.1, 17.0.3, 16.11.5
14 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-5655 (9.6 Critical) Run pipelines as any user
  • CVE-2024-4901 (8.7 high) Stored XSS injected in imported project's commit notes
  • CVE-2024-4994 (8.1 high) CSRF on GraphQL API IntrospectionQuery
  • CVE-2024-6323 (7.5 high) Remove search results from public projects with unauthorized repos
  • CVE-2024-2177 (6.8 medium) Cross window forgery in user application OAuth flow
  • CVE-2024-5430 (6.8 medium) Project maintainers can bypass group's merge request approval policy
  • CVE-2024-4025 (6.5 medium) ReDoS via custom built markdown page
  • CVE-2024-3959 (6.5 medium) Private job artifacts can be accessed by any user
  • CVE-2024-4557 (6.5 medium) Security fixes for banzai pipeline
  • CVE-2024-1493 (6.5 medium) ReDoS in dependency linker
  • CVE-2024-1816 (5.3 medium) Denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file
  • CVE-2024-2191 (5.3 medium) Merge request title disclosure
  • CVE-2024-3115 (4.3 medium) Access issues and epics without having an SSO session
  • CVE-2024-4011 (3.1 low) Non project member can promote key results to objectives

##

CVE-2024-4011
(3.1 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-27T00:31:05

4 posts

An issue was discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows non-project member to promote key results to objectives.

H3liumb0y at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.552Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.000Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

CVE-2024-6323 - High
Improper authorization in global search in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 16.11 prior to 16.11.5 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.3 and 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 allows an attacker leak content of a private repository in a public project.

CVE-2024-4901 - High
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, where a stored XSS vulnerability could be imported from a project with malicious commit notes.

CVE-2024-1816 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 12.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows for an attacker to cause a denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file.

CVE-2024-2191 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

CVE-2024-3959 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium
Multiple Denial of Service DoS conditions has been discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

CVE-2024-5430 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

CVE-2024-4011 - Low
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

Tags

#GitLab #CVE-2024-5655 #CWE-284 #CWE-79 #CWE-352 #SecurityPatch #Vulnerability #DevOps #CI/CD

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-26T19:29:26.000Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Critical Patch Release: 17.1.1, 17.0.3, 16.11.5
14 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-5655 (9.6 Critical) Run pipelines as any user
  • CVE-2024-4901 (8.7 high) Stored XSS injected in imported project's commit notes
  • CVE-2024-4994 (8.1 high) CSRF on GraphQL API IntrospectionQuery
  • CVE-2024-6323 (7.5 high) Remove search results from public projects with unauthorized repos
  • CVE-2024-2177 (6.8 medium) Cross window forgery in user application OAuth flow
  • CVE-2024-5430 (6.8 medium) Project maintainers can bypass group's merge request approval policy
  • CVE-2024-4025 (6.5 medium) ReDoS via custom built markdown page
  • CVE-2024-3959 (6.5 medium) Private job artifacts can be accessed by any user
  • CVE-2024-4557 (6.5 medium) Security fixes for banzai pipeline
  • CVE-2024-1493 (6.5 medium) ReDoS in dependency linker
  • CVE-2024-1816 (5.3 medium) Denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file
  • CVE-2024-2191 (5.3 medium) Merge request title disclosure
  • CVE-2024-3115 (4.3 medium) Access issues and epics without having an SSO session
  • CVE-2024-4011 (3.1 low) Non project member can promote key results to objectives

#GitLab #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-5430
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-27T00:31:05

4 posts

An issue was discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

H3liumb0y at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.552Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

CVE-2024-6323 - High
Improper authorization in global search in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 16.11 prior to 16.11.5 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.3 and 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 allows an attacker leak content of a private repository in a public project.

CVE-2024-4901 - High
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, where a stored XSS vulnerability could be imported from a project with malicious commit notes.

CVE-2024-1816 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 12.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows for an attacker to cause a denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file.

CVE-2024-2191 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

CVE-2024-3959 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium
Multiple Denial of Service DoS conditions has been discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

CVE-2024-5430 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

CVE-2024-4011 - Low
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

Tags

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.000Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

CVE-2024-6323 - High
Improper authorization in global search in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 16.11 prior to 16.11.5 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.3 and 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 allows an attacker leak content of a private repository in a public project.

CVE-2024-4901 - High
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, where a stored XSS vulnerability could be imported from a project with malicious commit notes.

CVE-2024-1816 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 12.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows for an attacker to cause a denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file.

CVE-2024-2191 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows merge request title to be visible publicly despite being set as project members only.

CVE-2024-3959 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.7 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows private job artifacts can be accessed by any user.

CVE-2024-4557 - Medium
Multiple Denial of Service DoS conditions has been discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 1.0 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 which allowed an attacker to cause resource exhaustion via banzai pipeline.

CVE-2024-5430 - Medium
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.10 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows a project maintainer can delete the merge request approval policy via graphQL.

CVE-2024-4011 - Low
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.1 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows nonproject member to promote key results to objectives.

Technical Key Findings

  • Run pipelines as any user: A critical vulnerability (CVSS 9.6) enabling attackers to trigger pipelines under another user's identity.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: High severity vulnerability (CVSS 8.7) allowing XSS injection through imported project commit notes.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: High severity issue (CVSS 8.1) permitting unauthorized GraphQL mutations via CSRF attacks.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitLab CE/EE versions from 15.8 to 16.11.4, 17.0 to 17.0.2, and 17.1 to 17.1.0.

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized code execution, sensitive data exposure, and potential takeover of GitLab instances.

  • Run pipelines as any user: This vulnerability enables attackers to execute code and perform actions on behalf of other users without authorization. It bypasses standard access controls, allowing malicious actors to manipulate the CI/CD pipeline as if they were legitimate users. This could lead to unauthorized changes in the codebase, deployment of malicious software, or alteration of critical infrastructure configurations.
  • Stored XSS in commit notes: Stored XSS vulnerabilities persist in the application until explicitly removed, with malicious scripts injected into commit notes that can affect every user viewing these notes. The wide attack surface includes multiple users such as developers and project managers, increasing the risk as each view can trigger the malicious script.
  • CSRF on GraphQL API: This vulnerability is easy to exploit and has a wide-ranging impact on system confidentiality and integrity, affecting multiple users and components due to the extensive use of GraphQL APIs in GitLab.## Patches or WorkaroundImmediate upgrade to the patched versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, or 16.11.5 is strongly recommended. Details on upgrading can be found on the GitLab update page.

Tags

  • CVE-2024-4901 (8.7 high) Stored XSS injected in imported project's commit notes
  • CVE-2024-4994 (8.1 high) CSRF on GraphQL API IntrospectionQuery
  • CVE-2024-6323 (7.5 high) Remove search results from public projects with unauthorized repos
  • CVE-2024-2177 (6.8 medium) Cross window forgery in user application OAuth flow
  • CVE-2024-5430 (6.8 medium) Project maintainers can bypass group's merge request approval policy
  • CVE-2024-4025 (6.5 medium) ReDoS via custom built markdown page
  • CVE-2024-3959 (6.5 medium) Private job artifacts can be accessed by any user
  • CVE-2024-4557 (6.5 medium) Security fixes for banzai pipeline

(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-27T00:31:05

4 posts

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T05:52:47.000Z ##

GitLab Critical Security Patch Release: 17.1.1

Date: June 26, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-5655
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-79]], [[CWE-352]]
Sources: GitLab Patch Release

Synopsis

GitLab released a critical security patch (versions 17.1.1, 17.0.3, and 16.11.5) to address several vulnerabilities, including a critical issue that allows attackers to run pipelines as any user.

Issue Summary

The latest GitLab patch addresses critical and high-severity vulnerabilities that could allow attackers to exploit the system, such as running pipelines as any user and injecting stored XSS in commit notes. These vulnerabilities affect versions from 15.8 to 17.1.0.

CVE-2024-5655 - CRITICAL
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 15.8 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as another user under certain circumstances.

CVE-2024-6323 - High
Improper authorization in global search in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 16.11 prior to 16.11.5 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.3 and 17.1 prior to 17.1.1 allows an attacker leak content of a private repository in a public project.

CVE-2024-4901 - High
An issue was discovered in GitLab CEEE affecting all versions starting from 16.9 prior to 16.11.5, starting from 17.0 prior to 17.0.3, and starting from 17.1 prior to 17.1.1, where a stored XSS vulnerability could be imported from a project with malicious commit notes.
