##

CVE-2024-2961(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-10T18:31:59

4 posts

The iconv() function in the GNU C Library versions 2.39 and older may overflow the output buffer passed to it by up to 4 bytes when converting strings to the ISO-2022-CN-EXT character set, which may be used to crash an application or overwrite a neighbouring variable.

7 repos

https://github.com/exfil0/test_iconv

https://github.com/mattaperkins/FIX-CVE-2024-2961

https://github.com/ambionics/cnext-exploits

https://github.com/tnishiox/cve-2024-2961

https://github.com/rvizx/CVE-2024-2961

https://github.com/kjdfklha/CVE-2024-2961_poc

https://github.com/absolutedesignltd/iconvfix

screaminggoat at 2024-06-26T14:03:42.391Z ##

AssetNote: Why nested deserialization is harmful: Magento XXE (CVE-2024-34102)
AssetNote provides a vulnerability analysis for CVE-2024-34102 (9.8 critical, disclosed 11 June 2024 by Adobe) Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference ('XXE') vulnerability in Adobe Commerce. Apparently CVE-2024-34102 is dubbed #CosmicSting by Sansec. AssetNote thinks the vulnerability is severe due to the following reasons:

  • It is possible to exfiltrate the app/etc/env.php file from Magento, which contains a cryptographic key used to sign JWTs used for authentication. An attacker can craft an administrator JWT and abuse Magento's APIs as an admin user on affected installations.
  • The vulnerability can be chained with recent research in PHP filter chains leading to RCE through the CVE-2024-2961 exploit
  • The broader impacts of XXE (any local file or remote URL's contents can be exfiltrated).

AssetNote patch diffed to find the root cause, and provides a walkthrough to crafting a proof of concept exploit.

#CVE_2024_34102 #vulnerability #AdobeCommerce #Magento #CVE

AssetNote provides a vulnerability analysis for CVE-2024-34102 (9.8 critical, disclosed 11 June 2024 by Adobe) Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference ('XXE') vulnerability in Adobe Commerce. Apparently CVE-2024-34102 is dubbed #CosmicSting by Sansec. AssetNote thinks the vulnerability is severe due to the following reasons:

  • It is possible to exfiltrate the app/etc/env.php file from Magento, which contains a cryptographic key used to sign JWTs used for authentication. An attacker can craft an administrator JWT and abuse Magento's APIs as an admin user on affected installations.
  • The vulnerability can be chained with recent research in PHP filter chains leading to RCE through the CVE-2024-2961 exploit
  • The broader impacts of XXE (any local file or remote URL's contents can be exfiltrated).

##

CVE-2024-28995
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 34.34%

updated 2024-06-06T09:30:52

10 posts

SolarWinds Serv-U was susceptible to a directory transversal vulnerability that would allow access to read sensitive files on the host machine.

Nuclei template

7 repos

https://github.com/karkis3c/cves

https://github.com/ggfzx/CVE-2024-28995

https://github.com/Praison001/CVE-2024-28995-SolarWinds-Serv-U

https://github.com/0xkucing/CVE-2024-28995

https://github.com/bigb0x/CVE-2024-28995

https://github.com/krypton-kry/CVE-2024-28995

https://github.com/huseyinstif/CVE-2024-28995-Nuclei-Template

todb at 2024-06-23T15:07:43.907Z ##

@securityaffairs I would love to see some evidence of attackers who are either:

a) reading secret system files that are useful to attackers, like secret credentials, then using them to gain real RCE access, or

b) reading other Serv-U user files since the point of Serv-U is to provide secure file transfer

Something beyond mere scanning by running the neutered public PoCs.

(a) should be easy and universal to automate, and to spot by log checking, while (b) is probably more monetizable, but will be site-specific.

I’m kind of surprised nobody’s actually been popped by CVE-2024-28995 yet. It’s easy to exploit, scanning activity abounds, and if you run it, you should patch, immediately.

But I’m not seeing any reports of real harm yet.

##
jbhall56 at 2024-06-21T11:13:03.863Z ##

The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-28995 (CVSS score: 8.6), concerns a directory transversal bug that could allow attackers to read sensitive files on the host machine. https://thehackernews.com/2024/06/solarwinds-serv-u-vulnerability-under.html

##
lmk at 2024-06-20T19:08:44.080Z ##

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-19T02:26:15.000Z ##

GreyNoise: SolarWinds Serv-U (CVE-2024-28995) exploitation: We see you!
GreyNoise analyzes exploitation attempts against their experimental honeypots that appear vulnerable to the SolarWinds Serv-U path-traversal vulnerability CVE-2024-28995 (see parent toots above for more info). Very interesting read to see threat actors' operational mistakes and determine whether it was an actual human being performing hands on keyboard activity. IOC are scattered throughout blog post.

#CVE_2024_28995 #CVE #vulnerability #solarwinds #activeexploitation #eitw

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-15T16:00:15.000Z ##

The Hacker Wire: Testing and Exploiting SolarWinds Serv-U (CVE-2024-28995) Vulnerability
Check out parent toots above for more security advisory and other contextual information about CVE-2024-28995

Exploiting CVE-2024-28995 flaw dose not require any authentication, complex payloads or interactions – just prior knowledge of the target file's path. An attacker can use something as simple as a web browser or curl to make the malicious HTTP request and disclose files.
The only limiting factor is whether the Serv-U service account has read access to the desired file path. By brute-forcing common file paths, an attacker could potentially map out a significant portion of the target's data.

A Proof of Concept bulk scanning utility was written in Python, and "allows checking multiple IPs or file paths in more efficient way."

cc: @reverseics @cR0w

#CVE_2024_28995 #CVE #vulnerability #solarwinds #proofofconcept #poc

##

CVE-2024-28999
(6.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 1.70%

updated 2024-06-04T15:31:07

2 posts

The SolarWinds Platform was determined to be affected by a Race Condition Vulnerability affecting the web console.

1 repos

https://github.com/HussainFathy/CVE-2024-28999

screaminggoat at 2024-06-25T13:46:49.194Z ##

0xSphinx: CVE-2024–28999 SolarWinds Race Condition
I was wondering what the race condition vulnerability entailed in CVE-2024-28999. See parent toot above for SolarWinds security advisory.

The vulnerability arises due to inadequate synchronization mechanisms during the authentication process. When multiple requests for login authentication are received concurrently, the system fails to properly handle, leading to brute force users even when the right “AccountLockoutThreshold” is configured, a malicious user can use a dictionary “words list” to be able to brute force into any account.

Poroof of Concept located here: https://github.com/HussainFathy/CVE-2024-28999

#CVE_2024_28999 #SolarWinds #CVE #vulnerability #proofofconcept #poc

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-25T13:46:49.000Z ##

0xSphinx: CVE-2024–28999 SolarWinds Race Condition
I was wondering what the race condition vulnerability entailed in CVE-2024-28999. See parent toot above for SolarWinds security advisory.

The vulnerability arises due to inadequate synchronization mechanisms during the authentication process. When multiple requests for login authentication are received concurrently, the system fails to properly handle, leading to brute force users even when the right “AccountLockoutThreshold” is configured, a malicious user can use a dictionary “words list” to be able to brute force into any account.

Poroof of Concept located here: https://github.com/HussainFathy/CVE-2024-28999

CVE-2024-5565
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-04T15:15:52

4 posts

The Vanna library uses a prompt function to present the user with visualized results, it is possible to alter the prompt using prompt injection and run arbitrary Python code instead of the intended visualization code. Specifically - allowing external input to the library’s “ask” method with "visualize" set to True (default behavior) leads to remote code execution.

jbz@indieweb.social at 2024-06-28T00:00:03.000Z ##

｢ Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed a high-severity security flaw in the VannaAI library that could be exploited to achieve remote code execution vulnerability via prompt injection techniques. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-5565 (CVSS score: 8.1), relates to a case of prompt injection in the "ask" function that could be exploited to trick the library into executing arbitrary ｣

https://thehackernews.com/2024/06/prompt-injection-flaw-in-vanna-ai.html

##

CVE-2024-0757(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-04T06:30:43

1 posts

The Insert or Embed Articulate Content into WordPress plugin through 4.3000000023 is not properly filtering which file extensions are allowed to be imported on the server, allowing the uploading of malicious code within zip files

1 repos

https://github.com/hunThubSpace/CVE-2024-0757-Exploit

DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-18T17:10:02.000Z ##

🚨POC RELEASED🚨A PoC Exploit for CVE-2024-0757 - Insert or Embed Articulate Content into WordPress Remote Code Execution (RCE)

The Insert or Embed Articulate Content into WordPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to arbitrary file uploads through insecure file uploads in a zip archive in all versions up to, and including, 4.3000000023. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to upload zip files containing phar files on the affected site's server which may make remote code execution possible.

CVSS: 8.8 (High) [CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H]
Software Type: Plugin
Software Slug: insert-or-embed-articulate-content-into-wordpress
Affected Version: <= 4.3000000023

https://x.com/DarkWebInformer/status/1803111898163920900

https://github.com/hunThubSpace/CVE-2024-0757-Exploit

##

CVE-2024-29973
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 93.66%

updated 2024-06-04T03:30:51

On June 25, 2024, Progress Software disclosed two auth bypass vulnerabilities in the SFTP module of their #MOVEit software:

CVE-2024-3661
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-05-18T05:03:51

2 posts

By design, the DHCP protocol does not authenticate messages, including for example the classless static route option (121). An attacker with the ability to send DHCP messages can manipulate routes to redirect VPN traffic, allowing the attacker to read, disrupt, or possibly modify network traffic that was expected to be protected by the VPN. Many, if not most VPN systems based on IP routing are sus

1 repos

https://github.com/a1xbit/DecloakingVPN

screaminggoat at 2024-06-24T21:44:04.002Z ##

Citrix security advisory: Cloud Software Group Security Advisory for CVE-2024-3661
If you're wondering why CVE-2024-3661 (7.6 high, assigned by CISA on 06 May 2024) looked familiar, this is known as #TunnelVision. See parent toots above for origin. Citrix notes that Secure Access client for Linux and for Mac/iOS are both impacted by CVE-2024-3661. Mac/iOS has a fix, while Linux does NOT (yet).

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-19T22:15:12.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) updated the security advisory for CVE-2024-30045 (6.3 medium, disclosed 14 May 2024 (Patch Tuesday)) .NET and Visual Studio Remote Code Execution Vulnerability for the following reason:

Revised the Security Updates table to include PowerShell 7.4 because this version of PowerShell 7 is affected by this vulnerability. See https://github.com/PowerShell/Announcements/issues/62 for more information.

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. Normally I wouldn't mention an older vulnerability but it's a slow news day and they did update this.

##

CVE-2024-3833(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-12T05:04:00

4 posts

Object corruption in WebAssembly in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.60 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit object corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-06-27T14:33:34.939Z ##

Github: Attack of the clones: Getting RCE in Chrome's renderer with duplicate object properties
It's amazing how much information is hidden from a vulnerability's description. See parent toot above for the Google Chrome security advisory. CVE-2024-3833 (disclosed 16 April 2024) is described as "Object corruption in WebAssembly" and high severity. The description provided to MITRE (and NVD) is "Object corruption in WebAssembly in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.60 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit object corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)."
Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab provides the full vulnerability details for CVE-2024-3833, an object corruption bug in the V8 Javascript engine that allows remote code execution in the renderer sandbox of Chrome by a single visit to a malicious site. CVE-2024-3833 allows duplicate properties be created in a V8 object, which is similar to the bug in CVE-2021-30561. By exploiting it in a different way, they achieve type confusion which then becomes out-of-bounds (OOB) access in a JavaScript Array, and subsequently arbitrary read and write inside the v8 heap:

As v8 has recently implemented the v8 heap sandbox, getting arbitrary memory read and write in the v8 heap is not sufficient to achieve code execution. In order to achieve code execution, I overwrite jump targets of WebAssembly imported functions, which were stored in the v8 heap. By rewriting the jump targets to locations of shell code, I can execute arbitrary code calling imported functions in a WebAssembly module.

#CVE_2024_3833 #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #POC #CVE_2021_30561

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T14:33:34.000Z ##

CVE-2024-34470(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-05-06T15:30:48

1 posts

An issue was discovered in HSC Mailinspector 5.2.17-3 through v.5.2.18. An Unauthenticated Path Traversal vulnerability exists in the /public/loader.php file. The path parameter does not properly filter whether the file and directory passed are part of the webroot, allowing an attacker to read arbitrary files on the server.

Nuclei template

5 repos

https://github.com/osvaldotenorio/CVE-2024-34470

https://github.com/Mr-r00t11/CVE-2024-34470

https://github.com/th3gokul/CVE-2024-34470

https://github.com/Cappricio-Securities/CVE-2024-34470

https://github.com/bigb0x/CVE-2024-34470

DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-20T21:43:16.000Z ##

🚨POC RELEASED🚨CVE-2024-34470 "A critical vulnerability has been found in HSC Mailinspector up to version 5.2.18. This vulnerability affects an unknown functionality of the file /public/loader.php. Manipulating the 'path' argument with an unknown input leads to a path traversal vulnerability. According to CWE, this issue is classified as CWE-22.

The product uses external input to construct a pathname intended to identify a file or directory located beneath a restricted parent directory, but the product does not properly neutralize special elements within the pathname that can cause the pathname to resolve to a location outside of the restricted directory. This affects confidentiality, integrity, and availability."

https://github.com/Mr-r00t11/CVE-2024-34470

https://x.com/DarkWebInformer/status/1803905811229352212

##

CVE-2024-21378
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-04-21T05:02:41

5 posts

Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

1 repos

https://github.com/d0rb/CVE-2024-21378

screaminggoat at 2024-06-22T12:36:09.418Z ##

Robel Campbell of Blackpoint Cyber performed patch diffing and root cause analysis on the Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-30103 (see parent toot for links) and stated the following:

  • It requires valid credentials of the target user to exploit. This is important to know because there is a lot of posting calling this a 'zero-click' exploit and while it might be true to an extent, you still need to be able to create a Form in the target users Outlook client, which requires authorization.
  • It's a bypass for a previously patched vulnerability (CVE-2024-21378)
  • Indicators of exploitation may include a suspicious DLL loaded in the Outlook.exe process, suspicious outbound connections from Outlook.exe and spawned child processes.
  • Exploitation is less likely at a large scale given that an attacker would need a user's credentials to set the attack up. Applying the latest patches is the best way to defend against this exploit.

View the original message at the bad site: https://twitter.com/RobelCampbell/status/1804171069558755624 cc: @GossiTheDog

#CVE_2024_30103 #CVE_2024_21378 #Outlook #vulnerability #CVE #Microsoft

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-21T14:36:22.986Z ##

NetSPI: CVE-2024-21378 — Remote Code Execution in Microsoft Outlook
NetSPI provides vulnerability details and a proof of concept for CVE-2024-21378 (8.8 high, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Microsoft) Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability via synced form objects. They covered how CVE-2024-21378 was discovered and weaponized it by modifying the Outlook pentesting tool "Ruler." A pull request containing the proof of concept is provided on GitHub.

Due to the renewed interest in Outlook RCE (see parent toot above), people on Twitter are resharing CVE-2024-21378.

#CVE_2024_21378 #Outlook #RCE #vulnerability #CVE #Microsoft

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-22T12:36:09.000Z ##

Robel Campbell of Blackpoint Cyber performed patch diffing and root cause analysis on the Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2024-30103 (see parent toot for links) and stated the following:

  • It requires valid credentials of the target user to exploit. This is important to know because there is a lot of posting calling this a 'zero-click' exploit and while it might be true to an extent, you still need to be able to create a Form in the target users Outlook client, which requires authorization.
  • It's a bypass for a previously patched vulnerability (CVE-2024-21378)
  • Indicators of exploitation may include a suspicious DLL loaded in the Outlook.exe process, suspicious outbound connections from Outlook.exe and spawned child processes.
  • Exploitation is less likely at a large scale given that an attacker would need a user's credentials to set the attack up. Applying the latest patches is the best way to defend against this exploit.

View the original message at the bad site: https://twitter.com/RobelCampbell/status/1804171069558755624 cc: @GossiTheDog

#CVE_2024_30103 #CVE_2024_21378 #Outlook #vulnerability #CVE #Microsoft

Specifically, an application is vulnerable if: The application uses Authenti

jbhall56 at 2024-06-20T11:45:01.062Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-22257, the most severe of these flaws is a broken access control issue in the Spring Framework that could allow unauthenticated attackers to expose assets they should not have access to. https://www.securityweek.com/atlassian-patches-high-severity-vulnerabilities-in-confluence-crucible-jira/

##
H3liumb0y at 2024-06-20T07:51:20.337Z ##

Security Bulletin: Atlassian June 2024

Date: June 18, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-22257
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-918]], [[CWE-400]]
Sources: Atlassian Documentation, NVD

Synopsis

Atlassian has released a security bulletin addressing multiple high-severity vulnerabilities in its products. These vulnerabilities, discovered through the company's Bug Bounty program and third-party scans, have been fixed in recent versions.

Issue Summary

Nine high-severity vulnerabilities affecting various Atlassian products were disclosed. These vulnerabilities include issues such as improper authorization and server-side request forgery (SSRF) in dependencies like org.springframework.security:spring-security-core and org.springframework:spring-web. Confluence, Jira, and Fisheye/Crucible are among the affected products.

Technical Key Findings

The vulnerabilities primarily involve improper authorization and SSRF, which allow attackers to exploit insufficient validation of user inputs. For instance, CVE-2024-22257 involves improper authorization due to flaws in the org.springframework.security:spring-security-core dependency, potentially leading to unauthorized access.

Vulnerable Products

  • Confluence Data Center and Server: Versions 8.9.0 to 8.9.2, 8.8.0 to 8.8.1, 8.7.1 to 8.7.2, among others.
  • Fisheye/Crucible: Versions 4.8.10 to 4.8.14.
  • Jira Data Center and Server: Versions 9.12.0 to 9.12.7 (LTS), 9.4.0 to 9.4.20 (LTS).
  • Jira Service Management: Versions 5.15.2, 5.12.0 to 5.12.7 (LTS).

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities could lead to unauthorized access, denial of service (DoS), or information disclosure, significantly impacting the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the affected systems.

Patches or Workaround

Patches have been released for the affected products. Users are advised to update to the latest versions or apply the recommended fixed versions listed in the bulletin. No temporary mitigations are provided; hence, immediate patching is crucial.

Tags

#Atlassian #CVE-2024-22257 #ImproperAuthorization #SSRF #DoS #Confluence #Jira #SecurityBulletin #Vulnerability

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-20T11:45:01.000Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-22257, the most severe of these flaws is a broken access control issue in the Spring Framework that could allow unauthenticated attackers to expose assets they should not have access to. https://www.securityweek.com/atlassian-patches-high-severity-vulnerabilities-in-confluence-crucible-jira/

H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-20T07:51:20.000Z ##

Security Bulletin: Atlassian June 2024

Date: June 18, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-22257
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-918]], [[CWE-400]]
Sources: Atlassian Documentation, NVD

Synopsis

Atlassian has released a security bulletin addressing multiple high-severity vulnerabilities in its products. These vulnerabilities, discovered through the company's Bug Bounty program and third-party scans, have been fixed in recent versions.

Issue Summary

Nine high-severity vulnerabilities affecting various Atlassian products were disclosed. These vulnerabilities include issues such as improper authorization and server-side request forgery (SSRF) in dependencies like org.springframework.security:spring-security-core and org.springframework:spring-web. Confluence, Jira, and Fisheye/Crucible are among the affected products.

Technical Key Findings

The vulnerabilities primarily involve improper authorization and SSRF, which allow attackers to exploit insufficient validation of user inputs. For instance, CVE-2024-22257 involves improper authorization due to flaws in the org.springframework.security:spring-security-core dependency, potentially leading to unauthorized access.

Vulnerable Products

  • Confluence Data Center and Server: Versions 8.9.0 to 8.9.2, 8.8.0 to 8.8.1, 8.7.1 to 8.7.2, among others.
  • Fisheye/Crucible: Versions 4.8.10 to 4.8.14.
  • Jira Data Center and Server: Versions 9.12.0 to 9.12.7 (LTS), 9.4.0 to 9.4.20 (LTS).
  • Jira Service Management: Versions 5.15.2, 5.12.0 to 5.12.7 (LTS).

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities could lead to unauthorized access, denial of service (DoS), or information disclosure, significantly impacting the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the affected systems.

Patches or Workaround

Patches have been released for the affected products. Users are advised to update to the latest versions or apply the recommended fixed versions listed in the bulletin. No temporary mitigations are provided; hence, immediate patching is crucial.

##

CVE-2024-20693
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-10T13:24:00.070000

1 posts

Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-15T15:36:11.000Z ##

Sector7: CVE-2024-20693: Windows cached code signature manipulation
I understand that vendors don't want to share information about vulnerabilities to the point where threat actors understand new attack vectors or variations of severe flaws. But when CVE-2024-20693 (7.8 high, disclosed 09 April 2024) is labeled "Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability," it looks like all of the other vulnerabilities with generalized titles and no description.
Sector7 reported CVE-2024-20693, which allows for manipulating the cached signature signing level of an executable or DLL. They describe how they discovered this issue and its impact. To be honest, there's no way to paraphrase this article or provide a concise summary. I would end up leaving an important detail out. They started with the presentation from @maddiestone and @tiraniddo The Print Spooler Bug that Wasn’t in the Print Spooler at OffensiveCon 2023 to undstand privilege escalation using an impersonated device map and isolation-aware DLLs. The mitigation from Microsoft was not thorough enough, and a lot of privileged services were left with the same issue. They found wscsvc.dll and got sidetracked into finding a signature bypass of Windows DLL files. I'm trying to understand their thought process at a glance, but they've written it as a walkthrough to elevate privileges, bypass WDAC and inject code into protected processes. They plan out a scenario where a user opens a downloaded file (leveraging an unrelated Mark-of-the-Web bypass vulnerability) to full system compromise. Video demonstrates proof of concept.
Sector7 notes that Microsoft didn't fix the problem directly but fixed the instances that were exploited. The timeline also shows Microsoft Security Response Center taking 8 months to resolve a confirmed vulnerability that they successfully reproduced, and that the Microsoft Bounty Team disagreeing 1 month afterward on awarding a bounty.

#CVE_2024_20693 #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #eop

CVE-2023-20867
(3.9 LOW)

EPSS: 0.50%

updated 2024-04-04T04:47:29

1 posts

A fully compromised ESXi host can force VMware Tools to fail to authenticate host-to-guest operations, impacting the confidentiality and integrity of the guest virtual machine.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-19T02:12:17.000Z ##

Mandiant: Cloaked and Covert: Uncovering UNC3886 Espionage Operations
Mandiant blogs about the Chinese state-sponsored espionage actor UNC3886. They discuess UNC3886's intrusion path and subsequent actions that were performed in the environments after compromising the guest virtual machines to achieve access to the critical systems, including:

  • The use of publicly available rootkits for long-term persistence
  • Deployment of malware that leveraged trusted third-party services for C2
  • Subverting access and collecting credentials with Secure Shell (SSH) backdoors
  • Extracting credentials from TACACS+ authentication using custom malware

Vulnerabilities exploited by UNC3886 include CVE-2023-34048, CVE-2022-41328, CVE-2022-22948 (surprisingly not in the KEV Catalog cc: @todb) and CVE-2023-20867. The TACACS+ section is really informative and interesting. IOC and Yara rules provided.

#threatintel #UNC3886 #china #cyberespionage #CVE_2022_41328 #CVE_2023_34048 #CVE_2022_22948 #CVE_2023_20867 #IOC #Yara

##

CVE-2023-38039
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.93%

updated 2024-04-01T15:45:33.510000

1 posts

When curl retrieves an HTTP response, it stores the incoming headers so that they can be accessed later via the libcurl headers API. However, curl did not have a limit in how many or how large headers it would accept in a response, allowing a malicious server to stream an endless series of headers and eventually cause curl to run out of heap memory.

1 repos

https://github.com/Smartkeyss/CVE-2023-38039

bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-06-15T20:53:43.000Z ##

another insisted that you can make curl run out of memory by feeding it a long sequence of large HTTP headers. The exact problem we already fixed as a CVE last year (CVE-2023-38039). None of us could reproduce in a current version. Probably caused by a broken build by the reporter or something.

CVE-2024-25065(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-02-29T03:33:28

2 posts

Possible path traversal in Apache OFBiz allowing authentication bypass. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 18.12.12, that fixes the issue.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-21T14:43:49.905Z ##

SecureLayer7: Analysis of CVE-2024-25065: Apache OFBiz Security bypass
SecureLayer7 uses patch diffing to understand CVE-2024-25065 (CVSS score pending) path traversal in Apache OFBiz allowing authentication bypass. They perform static and dynamic analysis to walk the reader through the vulnerability. Proof of concept is not explicitly stated but is described in Exploitation.

By exploiting this vulnerability, attackers can gain unauthorized access to various functionalities and data within the application. To mitigate this issue, update to Apache OFBiz version 18.12.12 or later, where the vulnerability has been patched by normalizing the contextPath variable to ensure it is a valid URI.

h/t: @buherator cc: @reverseics

#CVE_2024_25065 #Apache #Ofbiz #vulnerability #CVE

They perform static and dynamic analysis to walk the reader through the vulnerability. Proof of concept is not explicitly stated but is described in Exploitation.

By exploiting this vulnerability, attackers can gain unauthorized access to various functionalities and data within the application. To mitigate this issue, update to Apache OFBiz version 18.12.12 or later, where the vulnerability has been patched by normalizing the contextPath variable to ensure it is a valid URI.

2 posts

### Impact A malicious BuildKit frontend or Dockerfile using `RUN --mount` could trick the feature that removes empty files created for the mountpoints into removing a file outside the container, from the host system. ### Patches The issue has been fixed in v0.12.5 ### Workarounds Avoid using BuildKit frontend from an untrusted source or building an untrusted Dockerfile containing `RUN --mount`

This article discusses a critical vulnerability (CVE-2024-23652) in Docker Buildkit = v0.12.4, which allows arbitrary file deletion in the host OS

Mitigation involves updating to Buildkit v0.12.5 or later

vCenter Server contains an out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger an out-of-bounds write potentially leading to remote code execution.

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-18T10:02:44.000Z ##

Critical Vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server

Date: June 18, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081
Vulnerability Type: Buffer Overflow, Memory Corruption
CWE: [[CWE-787]], [[CWE-416]], [[CWE-125]]
Sources: SecurityWeek, Cybersecurity News, Broadcom VMware advisory

Synopsis

Multiple critical vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server have been identified, potentially allowing remote code execution (RCE). These issues, detailed in VMware's security advisory VMSA-2024-0012, include CVE-2023-34048, which affects the DCE/RPC protocol implementation. The DCE/RPC (Distributed Computing Environment / Remote Procedure Call) protocol is a network protocol developed by the Open Group. It enables communication between client and server applications by allowing a program to request services from a program located on another computer within a network. DCE/RPC is based on the concept of remote procedure calls (RPC), which facilitate the execution of code on a remote system as if it were local.

Issue Summary

VMware vCenter Server, a key management component for VMware environments, contains several critical vulnerabilities. If exploited, these could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely. The most critical of these, CVE-2023-34048, has been rated with a CVSS score of 9.8, indicating high severity.

Technical Key Findings

The vulnerabilities primarily involve memory corruption issues such as heap overflow and use-after-free errors in the DCE/RPC protocol. These can be exploited by sending specially crafted packets to the vCenter Server, leading to remote code execution and potential system compromise.

Vulnerable Products

  • vCenter Server 8.0
  • vCenter Server 7.0
  • VMware Cloud Foundation versions 4.x and 5.x

**Response Matrix:

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| ------------------ | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 8.0 U2d | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080 | 9.8, 9.8 | Critical | 8.0 U1e | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 7.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 7.0 U3r | None | FAQ |

**

Impacted Product Suites that Deploy Response Matrix 3a and 3b Components:

*

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| --------------------------------- | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 5.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 4.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |

Impact Assessment

Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could result in complete control over the affected systems, allowing attackers to perform any action, including data theft, service disruption, and further network compromise.

Patches or Workarounds

VMware has released patches to address these vulnerabilities. Administrators are advised to update to the fixed versions (8.0 U2d, 7.0 U3r) . There are no available workarounds.

Tags

#VMware #vCenterServer #CVE-2023-34048 #RemoteCodeExecution #PatchManagement #Cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-21887
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.85%

screaminggoat at 2024-06-25T15:55:34.176Z ##

Fortinet: The Growing Threat of Malware Concealed Behind Cloud Services
Fortinet talks about botnets leveraging cloud storage and computing services operators to distribute malware payloads and updates to a broad range of devices. They observed a threat actor exploiting multiple vulnerabilities to target JAWS webservers, Dasan GPON home routers, Huawei HG532 routers, TP-Link Archer AX21, and Ivanti Connect Secure. Botnets include: UNSTABLE and Condi DDoS. Vulnerabilities exploited include:

  • CVE-2016-20016 (9.8 critical) MVPower CCTV DVR, aka JAWS webserver RCE
  • CVE-2017-17215 (8.8 high) Huawei HG532 router RCE
  • CVE-2018-10561 (9.8 critical) Dasan GPON home router authentication bypass (in KEV)
  • CVE-2018-10562 (9.8 critical) Dasan GPON home router command injection (in KEV)
  • CVE-2023-1389 (8.8 high) TP-Link Archer AX21 command injection (in KEV)
  • CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure command injection (in KEV)

The first two vulnerabilities are unlikely to make it into CISA's KEV Catalog (cc: @todb). IOC provided.

#threatintel #activeexploitation #eitw #botnet #IOC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-25T15:55:34.000Z ##

Fortinet: The Growing Threat of Malware Concealed Behind Cloud Services
Fortinet talks about botnets leveraging cloud storage and computing services operators to distribute malware payloads and updates to a broad range of devices. They observed a threat actor exploiting multiple vulnerabilities to target JAWS webservers, Dasan GPON home routers, Huawei HG532 routers, TP-Link Archer AX21, and Ivanti Connect Secure. Botnets include: UNSTABLE and Condi DDoS. Vulnerabilities exploited include:

  • CVE-2016-20016 (9.8 critical) MVPower CCTV DVR, aka JAWS webserver RCE
  • CVE-2017-17215 (8.8 high) Huawei HG532 router RCE
  • CVE-2018-10561 (9.8 critical) Dasan GPON home router authentication bypass (in KEV)
  • CVE-2018-10562 (9.8 critical) Dasan GPON home router command injection (in KEV)
  • CVE-2023-1389 (8.8 high) TP-Link Archer AX21 command injection (in KEV)
  • CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure command injection (in KEV)

The first two vulnerabilities are unlikely to make it into CISA's KEV Catalog (cc: @todb). IOC provided.

The manipulation of the argument service with the input ../../../../htdocs/webinc/getcfg/DHCPS6.BRIDGE-1.xml leads to path traversal. The attack may be launched re

screaminggoat at 2024-06-27T22:54:56.844Z ##

GreyNoise: Perma-Vuln: D-Link DIR-859, CVE-2024-0769
D-Link is the gift that keeps on giving: GreyNoise reports that CVE-2024-0769 (9.8 critical, disclosed 20 January 2024) D-Link DIR-859 WiFi router path traversal (cc: @reverseics @cR0w) to information disclosure vulnerability is being exploited in the wild (cc: @todb):

the product is End-of-Life (EOL) meaning it will never recieve a patch.
While the exploit conditions are the same as the public PoC, the variation as observed by GreyNoise is dumping all name, password, group, and description for all users of the device.

#CVE_2024_0769 #Dlink #vulnerability #CVE #eitw #activeexploitation

the product is End-of-Life (EOL) meaning it will never recieve a patch.
While the exploit conditions are the same as the public PoC, the variation as observed by GreyNoise is dumping all name, password, group, and description for all users of the device.

CVE-2022-24834
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.32%

updated 2023-08-14T19:15:09.603000

1 posts

Redis is an in-memory database that persists on disk. A specially crafted Lua script executing in Redis can trigger a heap overflow in the cjson library, and result with heap corruption and potentially remote code execution. The problem exists in all versions of Redis with Lua scripting support, starting from 2.6, and affects only authenticated and authorized users. The problem is fixed in version

1 repos

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-25T15:55:34.176Z ##

Fortinet: The Growing Threat of Malware Concealed Behind Cloud Services
Fortinet talks about botnets leveraging cloud storage and computing services operators to distribute malware payloads and updates to a broad range of devices. They observed a threat actor exploiting multiple vulnerabilities to target JAWS webservers, Dasan GPON home routers, Huawei HG532 routers, TP-Link Archer AX21, and Ivanti Connect Secure. Botnets include: UNSTABLE and Condi DDoS. Vulnerabilities exploited include:

  • CVE-2016-20016 (9.8 critical) MVPower CCTV DVR, aka JAWS webserver RCE
  • CVE-2017-17215 (8.8 high) Huawei HG532 router RCE
  • CVE-2018-10561 (9.8 critical) Dasan GPON home router authentication bypass (in KEV)
  • CVE-2018-10562 (9.8 critical) Dasan GPON home router command injection (in KEV)
  • CVE-2023-1389 (8.8 high) TP-Link Archer AX21 command injection (in KEV)
  • CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure command injection (in KEV)

The first two vulnerabilities are unlikely to make it into CISA's KEV Catalog (cc: @todb). IOC provided.

#threatintel #activeexploitation #eitw #botnet #IOC

Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized access to cri

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-06-28T11:19:41.822Z ##

Trend Micro: Examining Water Sigbin's Infection Routine Leading to an XMRig Cryptominer
Water Sigbin (aka the financially motivated 8220 Gang) continues to exploit CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) and CVE-2023-21839 (7.5 high) to deploy cryptocurrency miners via a PowerShell script. The threat actor employs fileless execution techniques, using DLL reflective and process injection, allowing the malware code to run solely in memory and avoid disk-based detection mechanisms. This blog entry details the multi-stage loading technique that Water Sigbin uses to deliver the PureCrypter loader and XMRig cryptocurrency miner. Attack chain and IOC provided.

#threatintel #8220gang #WaterSigbin #cybercrime #cryptomining #IOC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-28T11:19:41.000Z ##

Trend Micro: Examining Water Sigbin's Infection Routine Leading to an XMRig Cryptominer
Water Sigbin (aka the financially motivated 8220 Gang) continues to exploit CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) and CVE-2023-21839 (7.5 high) to deploy cryptocurrency miners via a PowerShell script. The threat actor employs fileless execution techniques, using DLL reflective and process injection, allowing the malware code to run solely in memory and avoid disk-based detection mechanisms. This blog entry details the multi-stage loading technique that Water Sigbin uses to deliver the PureCrypter loader and XMRig cryptocurrency miner. Attack chain and IOC provided.

A improper limitation of a pathname to a restricted directory vulnerability ('path traversal') [CWE-22] in Fortinet FortiOS version 7.2.0 through 7.2.3, 7.0.0 through 7.0.9 and before 6.4.11 allows a privileged attacker to read and write files on the underlying Linux system via crafted CLI commands.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-19T02:12:17.000Z ##

Mandiant: Cloaked and Covert: Uncovering UNC3886 Espionage Operations
Mandiant blogs about the Chinese state-sponsored espionage actor UNC3886. They discuess UNC3886's intrusion path and subsequent actions that were performed in the environments after compromising the guest virtual machines to achieve access to the critical systems, including:

  • The use of publicly available rootkits for long-term persistence
  • Deployment of malware that leveraged trusted third-party services for C2
  • Subverting access and collecting credentials with Secure Shell (SSH) backdoors
  • Extracting credentials from TACACS+ authentication using custom malware

Vulnerabilities exploited by UNC3886 include CVE-2023-34048, CVE-2022-41328, CVE-2022-22948 (surprisingly not in the KEV Catalog cc: @todb) and CVE-2023-20867. The TACACS+ section is really informative and interesting. IOC and Yara rules provided.

#threatintel #UNC3886 #china #cyberespionage #CVE_2022_41328 #CVE_2023_34048 #CVE_2022_22948 #CVE_2023_20867 #IOC #Yara

Huawei HG532 with some customized versions has a remote code execution vulnerability. An authenticated attacker could send malicious packets to port 37215 to launch attacks. Successful exploit could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.

##

CVE-2016-20016
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 12.06%

updated 2023-02-02T05:08:14

2 posts

MVPower CCTV DVR models, including TV-7104HE 1.8.4 115215B9 and TV7108HE, contain a web shell that is accessible via a /shell URI. A remote unauthenticated attacker can execute arbitrary operating system commands as root. This vulnerability has also been referred to as the "JAWS webserver RCE" because of the easily identifying HTTP response server field. Other firmware versions, at least from 2014

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-06-25T15:55:34.176Z ##

Fortinet: The Growing Threat of Malware Concealed Behind Cloud Services
Fortinet talks about botnets leveraging cloud storage and computing services operators to distribute malware payloads and updates to a broad range of devices. They observed a threat actor exploiting multiple vulnerabilities to target JAWS webservers, Dasan GPON home routers, Huawei HG532 routers, TP-Link Archer AX21, and Ivanti Connect Secure. Botnets include: UNSTABLE and Condi DDoS. Vulnerabilities exploited include:

  • CVE-2016-20016 (9.8 critical) MVPower CCTV DVR, aka JAWS webserver RCE
  • CVE-2017-17215 (8.8 high) Huawei HG532 router RCE
  • CVE-2018-10561 (9.8 critical) Dasan GPON home router authentication bypass (in KEV)
  • CVE-2018-10562 (9.8 critical) Dasan GPON home router command injection (in KEV)
  • CVE-2023-1389 (8.8 high) TP-Link Archer AX21 command injection (in KEV)
  • CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) Ivanti Connect Secure command injection (in KEV)

The first two vulnerabilities are unlikely to make it into CISA's KEV Catalog (cc: @todb). IOC provided.

#threatintel #activeexploitation #eitw #botnet #IOC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-25T15:55:34.000Z ##

##

CVE-2018-10561
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.08%

updated 2023-02-02T05:03:55

2 posts

An issue was discovered on Dasan GPON home routers. It is possible to bypass authentication simply by appending "?images" to any URL of the device that requires authentication, as demonstrated by the /menu.html?images/ or /GponForm/diag_FORM?images/ URI. One can then manage the device.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-25T15:55:34.176Z ##

##

CVE-2018-10562
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.42%

updated 2023-02-02T05:01:49

2 posts

An issue was discovered on Dasan GPON home routers. Command Injection can occur via the dest_host parameter in a diag_action=ping request to a GponForm/diag_Form URI. Because the router saves ping results in /tmp and transmits them to the user when the user revisits /diag.html, it's quite simple to execute commands and retrieve their output.

Nuclei template

1 repos

#search_error

CVE-2017-3506
(7.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 86.86%

updated 2023-02-02T05:01:24

2 posts

Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server component of Oracle Fusion Middleware (subcomponent: Web Services). Supported versions that are affected are 10.3.6.0, 12.1.3.0, 12.2.1.0, 12.2.1.1 and 12.2.1.2. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via HTTP to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unaut

Nuclei template

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-06-28T11:19:41.822Z ##

Trend Micro: Examining Water Sigbin's Infection Routine Leading to an XMRig Cryptominer
Water Sigbin (aka the financially motivated 8220 Gang) continues to exploit CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) and CVE-2023-21839 (7.5 high) to deploy cryptocurrency miners via a PowerShell script. The threat actor employs fileless execution techniques, using DLL reflective and process injection, allowing the malware code to run solely in memory and avoid disk-based detection mechanisms. This blog entry details the multi-stage loading technique that Water Sigbin uses to deliver the PureCrypter loader and XMRig cryptocurrency miner. Attack chain and IOC provided.

#threatintel #8220gang #WaterSigbin #cybercrime #cryptomining #IOC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-28T11:19:41.000Z ##

Trend Micro: Examining Water Sigbin's Infection Routine Leading to an XMRig Cryptominer
Water Sigbin (aka the financially motivated 8220 Gang) continues to exploit CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) and CVE-2023-21839 (7.5 high) to deploy cryptocurrency miners via a PowerShell script. The threat actor employs fileless execution techniques, using DLL reflective and process injection, allowing the malware code to run solely in memory and avoid disk-based detection mechanisms. This blog entry details the multi-stage loading technique that Water Sigbin uses to deliver the PureCrypter loader and XMRig cryptocurrency miner. Attack chain and IOC provided.

#threatintel #8220gang #WaterSigbin #cybercrime #cryptomining #IOC

##

CVE-2007-1667(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 6.91%

updated 2023-01-31T05:03:54

2 posts

Multiple integer overflows in (1) the XGetPixel function in ImUtil.c in X.Org libx11 before 1.0.3, and (2) XInitImage function in xwd.c for ImageMagick, allow user-assisted remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or obtain sensitive information via crafted images with large or negative values that trigger a buffer overflow.

1 repos

#search_error

janl@narrativ.es at 2024-06-26T16:37:25.000Z ##

It’s not fair because I’ve only done a handful and my colleagues sent literally dozens of CVE clarifications to NIST, but one of mine got published already: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2007-1667#VulnChangeHistorySection

Background level 1: we are currently triaging old and new CVEs for correctness for Yocto specifically, but this being Linux packages, they will benefit all distros.

Background level 2: ImageMagick was listed as vulnerable because it *uses* libx11, but it does not *vend* it nor does it specifies safe versions.

##
janl@narrativ.es at 2024-06-26T16:37:25.000Z ##

It’s not fair because I’ve only done a handful and my colleagues sent literally dozens of CVE clarifications to NIST, but one of mine got published already: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2007-1667#VulnChangeHistorySection

Background level 1: we are currently triaging old and new CVEs for correctness for Yocto specifically, but this being Linux packages, they will benefit all distros.

Background level 2: ImageMagick was listed as vulnerable because it *uses* libx11, but it does not *vend* it nor does it specifies safe versions.

##

CVE-2021-30561(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.32%

updated 2023-01-30T05:01:13

4 posts

Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 91.0.4472.164 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-27T14:33:34.939Z ##

Github: Attack of the clones: Getting RCE in Chrome's renderer with duplicate object properties
It's amazing how much information is hidden from a vulnerability's description. See parent toot above for the Google Chrome security advisory. CVE-2024-3833 (disclosed 16 April 2024) is described as "Object corruption in WebAssembly" and high severity. The description provided to MITRE (and NVD) is "Object corruption in WebAssembly in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.60 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit object corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)."
Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab provides the full vulnerability details for CVE-2024-3833, an object corruption bug in the V8 Javascript engine that allows remote code execution in the renderer sandbox of Chrome by a single visit to a malicious site. CVE-2024-3833 allows duplicate properties be created in a V8 object, which is similar to the bug in CVE-2021-30561. By exploiting it in a different way, they achieve type confusion which then becomes out-of-bounds (OOB) access in a JavaScript Array, and subsequently arbitrary read and write inside the v8 heap:

As v8 has recently implemented the v8 heap sandbox, getting arbitrary memory read and write in the v8 heap is not sufficient to achieve code execution. In order to achieve code execution, I overwrite jump targets of WebAssembly imported functions, which were stored in the v8 heap. By rewriting the jump targets to locations of shell code, I can execute arbitrary code calling imported functions in a WebAssembly module.

#CVE_2024_3833 #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #POC #CVE_2021_30561

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-27T14:33:34.000Z ##

CVE-2022-22948
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 1.19%

updated 2023-01-27T05:01:05

1 posts

The vCenter Server contains an information disclosure vulnerability due to improper permission of files. A malicious actor with non-administrative access to the vCenter Server may exploit this issue to gain access to sensitive information.

1 repos

https://github.com/PenteraIO/CVE-2022-22948

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-19T02:12:17.000Z ##

Mandiant: Cloaked and Covert: Uncovering UNC3886 Espionage Operations
Mandiant blogs about the Chinese state-sponsored espionage actor UNC3886. They discuess UNC3886's intrusion path and subsequent actions that were performed in the environments after compromising the guest virtual machines to achieve access to the critical systems, including:

  • The use of publicly available rootkits for long-term persistence
  • Deployment of malware that leveraged trusted third-party services for C2
  • Subverting access and collecting credentials with Secure Shell (SSH) backdoors
  • Extracting credentials from TACACS+ authentication using custom malware

Vulnerabilities exploited by UNC3886 include CVE-2023-34048, CVE-2022-41328, CVE-2022-22948 (surprisingly not in the KEV Catalog cc: @todb) and CVE-2023-20867. The TACACS+ section is really informative and interesting. IOC and Yara rules provided.

#threatintel #UNC3886 #china #cyberespionage #CVE_2022_41328 #CVE_2023_34048 #CVE_2022_22948 #CVE_2023_20867 #IOC #Yara

CVE-2024-34122
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-06-27T20:15:17.726Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) has five total Chromium-based security advisories. See parent toot above for the Google Chrome blog post disclosing four of the CVE IDs on 25 June 2024. CVE-2024-6290 through CVE-2024-6293 are included by MSRC (note: MSRC got lazy and didn't include the whole description in the title e.g. "Chromium: CVE-2024-6290 Use after free in Dawn").
The new CVE ID is CVE-2024-34122 (7.3 high severity) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. Interestingly "The vulnerability assigned to this CVE is in Adobe Software which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based)." The Common Weakness and Enumeration is CWE-125: Out-of-bounds Read. It is marked Not exploited, Not publicly disclosed and Exploitation Less Likely.

#CVE_2024_34122 #MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE #Adobe

CVE-2024-37282
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-06-28T11:04:49.398Z ##

Elastic security advisory: Elastic Cloud Enterprise 3.7.2 Security Update (ESA-2024-18)
CVE-2024-37282 (8.1 high) ECE Improper Authorization. It was identified that under certain specific preconditions, an API key 2 that was originally created with a specific privileges could be subsequently used to create new API keys that have elevated privileges.

Affected ECE versions after 3.0.0 and before 3.7.2. Users should upgrade to version 3.7.2. No mention of exploitation

#CVE_2024_37282 #Elastic #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-28T11:04:49.000Z ##

Elastic security advisory: Elastic Cloud Enterprise 3.7.2 Security Update (ESA-2024-18)
CVE-2024-37282 (8.1 high) ECE Improper Authorization. It was identified that under certain specific preconditions, an API key 2 that was originally created with a specific privileges could be subsequently used to create new API keys that have elevated privileges.

Affected ECE versions after 3.0.0 and before 3.7.2. Users should upgrade to version 3.7.2. No mention of exploitation

#CVE_2024_37282 #Elastic #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-4994
(0 None)

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-06-26T19:29:26.695Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Critical Patch Release: 17.1.1, 17.0.3, 16.11.5
14 vulnerabilities, no mention of exploitation:

  • CVE-2024-5655 (9.6 Critical) Run pipelines as any user
  • CVE-2024-4901 (8.7 high) Stored XSS injected in imported project's commit notes
  • CVE-2024-4994 (8.1 high) CSRF on GraphQL API IntrospectionQuery
  • CVE-2024-6323 (7.5 high) Remove search results from public projects with unauthorized repos
  • CVE-2024-2177 (6.8 medium) Cross window forgery in user application OAuth flow
  • CVE-2024-5430 (6.8 medium) Project maintainers can bypass group's merge request approval policy
  • CVE-2024-4025 (6.5 medium) ReDoS via custom built markdown page
  • CVE-2024-3959 (6.5 medium) Private job artifacts can be accessed by any user
  • CVE-2024-4557 (6.5 medium) Security fixes for banzai pipeline
  • CVE-2024-1493 (6.5 medium) ReDoS in dependency linker
  • CVE-2024-1816 (5.3 medium) Denial of service using a crafted OpenAPI file
  • CVE-2024-2191 (5.3 medium) Merge request title disclosure
  • CVE-2024-3115 (4.3 medium) Access issues and epics without having an SSO session
  • CVE-2024-4011 (3.1 low) Non project member can promote key results to objectives

#GitLab #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

Hot off the press! CISA adds 3 to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2022-24816 (9.8 criutical) GeoSolutionsGroup JAI-EXT Code Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-2586 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel Use-After-Free Vulnerability
  • CVE-2020-13965 (6.1 medium) Roundcube Webmail Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability

CVE-2024-31317
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

1 repos

#search_error

MishaalRahman@androiddev.social at 2024-06-24T14:17:11.000Z ##

Plus, Android's app security model makes it less likely for the database to be exfiltrated even if unencrypted (you can't access other apps' private data directories in the internal storage without superuser [which isn't available to apps by default] or an exploit), at least compared to Windows, though it should still be encrypted due to the possibility of exploits like CVE-2024-31317 existing.

##
MishaalRahman@androiddev.social at 2024-06-24T14:17:11.000Z ##

Plus, Android's app security model makes it less likely for the database to be exfiltrated even if unencrypted (you can't access other apps' private data directories in the internal storage without superuser [which isn't available to apps by default] or an exploit), at least compared to Windows, though it should still be encrypted due to the possibility of exploits like CVE-2024-31317 existing.

##
obivan@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-22T09:25:31.000Z ##

Extracting WhatsApp Database (or any app data) from Android 12/13 using CVE-2024-0044 https://tinyhack.com/2024/06/07/extracting-whatsapp-database-or-any-app-data-from-android-12-13-using-cve-2024-0044/

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-19T17:47:40.000Z ##

🚨POC RELEASED🚨CVE-2024-0044: a "run-as any app" high-severity vulnerability affecting Android versions 12 and 13👇

"CVE-2024-0044, identified in the createSessionInternal function of the PackageInstallerService[.]java file, is a high-severity vulnerability affecting Android versions 12 and 13.

This vulnerability allows an attacker to perform a "run-as any app" attack, leading to local escalation of privilege without requiring user interaction. The issue arises due to improper input validation within the createSessionInternal function.

An attacker can exploit this by manipulating the session creation process, potentially gaining unauthorized access to sensitive data and performing unauthorized actions on the affected device​"

https://github.com/pl4int3xt/cve_2024_0044

https://x.com/DarkWebInformer/status/1803484475298377961

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-06-18T08:20:07.000Z ##

Extracting WhatsApp Database (or any app data) from Android 12/13 using CVE-2024-0044

I want to make a WhatsApp message backup from a non-rooted Android 12 Phone. A few years ago, I used Whatsapp-Chat-Exporter to convert the backup...

🔗️ [Tinyhack] https://link.is.it/ekfapj

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-06-17T12:20:05.000Z ##

Exfiltrate sensitive user data from apps on Android 12 and 13 using CVE-2024-0044 vulnerability

With physical access to Android device with enabled ADB debugging running Android 12 or 13 before receiving March 2024 security patch, it is...

🔗️ [Mobile-hacker] https://link.is.it/qjcklz

@geoserver 2.25.2 stable and 2.24.4 maintenance releases are up - address critical CVE-2024-36401 vulnerability.

Although 2.23.x reached end of life @geocat has made 2.23.6 as well.

Disclosure is set for end of month, given the amount of effort to get this fix to you please update promptly.

(Aslo there is one fun change a new demo request page)

CVE-2023-37080
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

1 posts

N/A

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-19T03:00:40.000Z ##

VMware security advisory disclosed 17 June 2024: VMSA-2024-0012:VMware vCenter Server updates address heap-overflow and privilege escalation vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081)

  • CVE-2024-37079 and CVE-2024-37080 (9.8 critical) heap-overflow vulnerability (sending a specially crafted network packet potentially leading to remote code execution)
  • CVE-2024-37081 (7.8 high) privilege escalation vulnerability (elevate privileges to root on vCenter Server Appliance)

No mention of exploitation. Fuck Broadcom though for making these security advisories harder to find and no public RSS feeds for it.

#VMware #PatchTuesday #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_37079 #CVE_2024_37080 #CVE_2024_37081
